title: Cryptocurrency TerraUSD Falls Below Fixed Value, Triggering Selloff
sub_head: Drop causes ripples in ether and bitcoin, exacerbating recent declines in their dollar values
body:
One type of cryptocurrency, a so-called stablecoin, is meant to keep its value at $1. But on Monday, the third-biggest stablecoin, TerraUSD, fell as low as 94 cents, causing a flood of investors to sell their holdings.
Stablecoins get their name from their being tied to the value of government-issued currencies, such as the dollar. These $1 pegs are usually backed by Treasurys, cash and other dollar debt that is easily sold in times of market stress.
